entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 10.22.24
entry.summary: 4th District Congresswoman Val Hoyle talks about her work in the the U.S. House for the past two years, and her priorities if she is re-elected.

entry.title: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST LIFTS HOMESTEAD COMPLEX CLOSURE
entry.summary: October 22, 2024 10:50 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has rescinded the most recent Homestead Complex Emergency Fire Closure order. A UNF release said the closure impacted parts of the North Umpqua, Diamond Lake and Cottage Grove ranger districts, which are now open. On the Devils Knob and Dixon Fire, administrative closures will be lifted...

entry.summary: October 22, 2024 6;50 a.m. Douglas County Commissioners are holding the open house and dedication for The Wayne Stinson Emergency Management Center Tuesday evening from 6:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. The facility is at 2646 Northeast Diamond Lake Boulevard in Roseburg. entry.title: BALLOTS BEGINNING TO BE RETURNED FOR GENERAL ELECTION
entry.summary: October 22, 2024 3:40 a.m. Ballots are beginning to be returned for the November 5th Presidential General Election. Douglas County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 2,112 ballots or 2.35 percent of ballots have been received as of late Monday afternoon. Loomis said that lags 4.42 percent behind the participation rate for the same point in the...

entry.title: BACKYARD DEBRIS BURNING OUTSIDE OF CITIES NOW ALLOWED
entry.summary: October 22, 2024 3:30 a.m. Backyard debris burning outside of incorporated cities is now allowed without a burn permit from the Douglas Forest Protective Association. DFPA Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said residents should contact their local fire departments before conducting any type of debris burning as fire restrictions may vary between local fire districts....

entry.title: KELLOGG RURAL FIRE DISTRICT RECEIVES $10,000 GRANT
entry.summary: October 22, 2024 3:20 a.m. The Kellogg Rural Fire District has announced that it is one of 100 volunteer fire departments across the nation to receive a $10,000 grant through the State Farm Good Neighbor Firefighter Safety Program. entry.title: FIRE SEASON OVER AS OF MONDAY AT 9:00 A.M.
entry.summary: October 21, 2024 11:15 a.m. The Douglas Forest Protective Association officially ended the 2024 fire season Monday as of 9:00 a.m. for lands under their protection and management. Public Information Officer Rachel Pope said the end of fire season is a result of recent wetting rains and an overall cooling trend that has returned to...

entry.summary: October 21, 2024 3:50 a.m. (updated at 6:20 a.m.) Roseburg had the first significant rainfall Sunday since mid-September. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the rain began late in the evening and measured .22 inches at the Roseburg Regional Airport. That is the highest...

entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL NOT MEETING MONDAY

entry.title: Idyl Oak Ranch hosts twilight tour group to see restoration efforts
entry.summary: OAKLAND — Idyl Oak Ranch hosted the Twilight Walk in the Woods tour for the Douglas Small Woodland Association, with landowners and guests flocking to see the restoration and fire-hardening efforts made by owners Kyle and Joan Gasior.

entry.title: Fire culture; How fire can be used to nurse our forests
entry.summary: Humans have experienced fire on all different levels. From the cultivation of fire thousands of years ago, to laughs shared around a campfire and the firefighters who battle the blaze. Humans have a complicated relationship with fire, yet rely so…

entry.title: Trading prescription pads for keyboards: McNulty follows life's passions
entry.summary: Brady McNulty decided to change his life drastically when he went from being a board certified geriatric pharmacist to a certified ethical hacker.
